title: [K-12] Mobile-Based Digital Mathematics Teaching Method Competency Enhancement Program for Medical Education Instructors: Integrated Approach to Equations, Statistics, and Geometry

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational medical education experience, digital device proficiency, and understanding of secondary-level mathematics concepts (equations, geometry, statistics, probability, proofs)
context.additional_context: Flexible learning environment using personal mobile devices (BYOD), emphasizing development of math-centric content immediately applicable in medical education (drug concentration calculations, patient data analysis, treatment efficacy prediction modeling, etc.). Integrated assessment of computational skills, graph interpretation, and data visualization competencies for achieving learning objectives.

learning_goals: Learners will enhance their competency in designing mobile learning platform-integrated medical scenario-linked math content (ratio calculations, statistical analysis, probability modeling, etc.) by over 80%

Learners will develop three or more interactive math educational materials (fraction operation quizzes, geometric shape simulations, equation graph analysis, etc.) using digital teaching tools (GeoGebra, Desmos, etc.) and achieve an average score of 4/5 or higher on a peer-reviewed and instructor-validated rubric

Learners will produce one or more mobile math education modules applicable to real-world medical training environments (dosage calculation simulations, patient data visualization, infection rate statistical forecasting, etc.) through project-based assessment
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
